stories.text: Klingon warships detected crossing the Neutral Zone. They've locked disruptors on our position!
The Klingon High Council has sent reinforcements. Today is a good day to die... for them.
A wing of Birds-of-Prey decloaks off the port bow in attack formation. Shields up!
Romulan Warbirds shimmer out of cloak alongside the Klingons. An unholy alliance has formed.
The simulation intensifies. Senator! The Federation cadet refuses to surrender the Kobayashi Maru.
The Tal Shiar commands this operation now. Prepare for precision strikes, cadet.
A transwarp conduit opens. We are the Borg. Your technological distinctiveness will be added to our own.
Resistance is futile. The Collective adapts... but so do we. Modulating phaser frequencies!
Sensors overloading! This isn't a no-win scenario anymore. It's a massacre in the making.
Species 8472 emerges from fluidic space. Even the Borg fear them. There is no retreat, cadet.
Long-range sensors detect another armada approaching. The simulation shows no mercy.
Admiral, recommend we recalibrate the holodeck safeties. This is getting out of hand!
The enemy fleet has adapted to our tactics. Starfleet Academy didn't prepare us for this.
Subspace distortions everywhere! They're coming from all directions now.
Captain's log: We have exceeded all survival projections. Still the enemy comes.
The Kobayashi Maru sends a final distress call. We will not abandon those 300 souls.
EPS conduits are overloading. Structural integrity at 47%. We stand our ground.
Make it so, cadet. Every second we survive defies the impossible.
They underestimated Starfleet's resolve. Q'apla! Victory through persistence!
The fleets multiply. This simulation was never meant to be beaten.
Incoming transmission from Starfleet Command: 'Hold the line. Reinforcements are... unavailable.'
The Tholians weave their crystalline web around the sector. Escape routes are closing.
Warp core temperature critical. We're running on auxiliary power and pure determination.
The Dominion sends their regards. Jem'Hadar attack ships decloak on all vectors!
Ketracel-white supplies detected in the enemy fleet. They won't stop until we're destroyed.
The Founders have taken an interest in this simulation. Shapeshifters among the crew?
Cardassian Galor-class cruisers join the assault. The Obsidian Order wants answers.
Gul Dukat's voice crackles over comms: 'Your Federation ideals end here, cadet.'
A temporal anomaly! Ships from multiple eras converge on our position.
The Department of Temporal Investigations won't be happy about this timeline.
Chroniton particles detected. Past and future enemies attack simultaneously.
Q appears on the bridge: 'Fascinating! I didn't think you'd last this long, mon capitaine.'
The Crystalline Entity approaches. Its beautiful song masks deadly intent.
Nanoprobes detected in the atmospheric system. The Borg are attempting assimilation.
Seven of Nine: 'Their tactical patterns are inefficient. We will adapt faster.'
Data calculates our survival probability at 0.0047%. He finds this 'intriguing.'
Picard's voice echoes: 'The line must be drawn HERE. This far, no further!'
Sisko channels the Prophets. The wormhole aliens whisper of linear time's end.
Janeway's log: 'Coffee. Black. And keep those quantum torpedoes coming.'
Kirk's ghost haunts the bridge: 'I don't believe in the no-win scenario, remember?'
Spock raises an eyebrow: 'The needs of the Kobayashi Maru outweigh the needs of the few.'
McCoy: 'I'm a doctor, not a miracle worker! Wait, we need a miracle worker!'
Scotty beams up from beyond: 'She cannae take much more of this, Captain!'
The Nexus ribbon appears. Temptation whispers of an existence without suffering.
Mirror universe ships phase through. In their world, the Kobayashi Maru fights back.
Tribbles infest the enemy fleet! Even the Borg seem confused by the fuzzy menace.
The Whale Probe returns. Its song disrupts all communications. Humpbacks, anyone?
V'Ger seeks its Creator. It finds only a stubborn cadet refusing to stand down.
Praxis explodes again in this timeline. Klingon moon debris adds to the chaos.
You've reached the final simulation level. The computer itself marvels at your tenacity.
